name: Software/IoT/Telecom/Cloud Engineering Manager
description:
A software and hardware development company based in Ireland with offices, R&D, and manufacturing spread across the globe, including Russia, Georgia, China, the US, and India is looking for responsible, creative and dedicated Engineering manager.

The company's product line is a whole ecosystem that includes a smart-home controller hub, router, mobile applications, android-based OOT, cloud solution, cybersecurity and parental control software.

The company experienced almost 100% growth Y.o.Y. in size of the engineering team in 2021 and is in an active growing phase.

The company offers dynamic and engaging work duties that provide opportunities for self-development and professional growth, competitive compensation commensurate with skills and experience, and a contributory pension.

Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to our telecoms and Smart Home vision and strategy;
  • Responsible for the successful execution and delivery of development programs across a wide area of technologies;
  • Manage a multidisciplinary team of 25+ engineers in a geographically distributed environment;
  • Attract, retain & develop teams of exceptionally-talented software developers;
  • Manage stakeholders and provide regular updates and executive briefings.

Requirements:

  • BSc in Computer Science, Data Science. Telecommunications or a relevant scientific/engineering field, with high academic achievement;
  • 12+ years industry experience, including at least 6 of management experience in a similar environment;
  • Proven track record leading successful teams and high-quality program delivery;
  • Knowledge of software engineering practices, tools and processes;
  • Good understanding of latest Smart Home, Wi-Fi, Telecoms and cloud technologies;
  • A proven technical leader, ideally within software engineering, big data and/or machine learning disciplines.

Conditions:

  • Remote work;
  • Dynamic and engaging work duties that provide opportunities for self-development and professional growth;
  • Competitive compensation commensurate with skills and experience;
  • Contributory pension.
